acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 72 hours ErC50=6mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals (2002) and others.).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) of 2,580mg/kg (lowest value) (BUA 168 (1995)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF=123(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on germ cell multi-generation mutagenicity tests in vivo/mutagenicity tests, somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (Some chromosome aberration tests show positive, which, however, is not reliable enough for use in classification), and germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.14 (2004). Dominant lethal tests show negative and germ in vivo/somatic cell micronucleus tests show both positive and negative, according to EDTA-2Na (CAS: 6381-92-6).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on mouse and rat teratogenicity tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.14 (2004)): Malformations (cleft palate, micrognathia, macrocephalia, ectrodactylia and hyperdactylia) are observed in offspring at dosing levels toxic to dams or at unknown dosages.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.14 (2004)): Edema, reddening and corneal opacity are observed, each of which disappears after eight days of exposure or earlier.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on Draize skin irritation tests using rabbits (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.14 (2004)): The substance does not cause skin irritation.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "tubular damage" (NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.14 (2005)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies (though there are some data suggesting the classification into "Not Classified"): The LD50 value of the substance depends a lot on the speed of administration because the substance administered intravenously disperses into body fluids quickly; quick administration results in the formation of calcium chelate, which reduces calcium ion concentrations in the serum quickly, thereby causing tetany (uncontrolled contractions of extremity muscles, laryngeal muscles, respiratory muscles, etc.) and death eventually; LD50 values, therefore, do not allow for easy comparison (NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.14 (2005)). The substance cannot be categorically considered "nontoxic."
